message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI

Reasoning: The paper introduces a new lexical resource that uses semantic features extracted from text corpora to boost the performance of frame disambiguation in context. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as distributional semantics and semantic feature extraction, which are commonly used in the fields of computational linguistics (cs.CL) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of OWL querying and reasoning, which falls under the sub-category of knowledge representation and reasoning (cs.LG). Additionally, the evaluation of the resource is done in the task of Word Frame Disambiguation (WFD), which is a sub-task of natural language processing and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper discusses the potential applications of the resource in developing semantic-aware applications, which could fall under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
